program.name: Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP)
program.description: CSFP is a senior food box program that provides a package of nutritious foods specifically selected to support the nutritional needs of older adults. CSFP food boxes are distributed monthly at participating program sites. CSFP food boxes have a retail value of about $50 per month and may include cereal, grits, powdered milk, pasta, cheese, rice, canned meat, peanut butter, canned fruit, canned vegetables, fruit juice, dry beans, and oats.
program.website_description: Monthly food packages for eligible seniors

documents.text: Proof of home address (ex: driver's license, utility bill, or mail with your name and address)
Proof of identity - name and date of birth verification

navigators.name: Greater Chicago Food Depository
navigators.description: If you would like to apply for CSFP, contact Greater Chicago Food Depository who will help you get started
